name: Armaan Malik
description:
'''Armaan Malik''' (born 22 July 1995) is an Indian [[playback singer]], songwriter, record producer, voice-over artist, and [[actor]]. He is known for his singing in multiple Indian languages. Previously represented by [[Universal Music India]] and [[T-Series (company)|T-Series]], he is now managed by [[Arista Records]]. He also owns a record label called [[Independent record label|Always Music Global]] in partnership with [[Warner Music Group|Warner Music India]]. His first on-screen appearance was in the film ''[[Kaccha Limboo]]'' in 2011. 

Armaan Malik has been at the forefront of India’s global music movement, becoming one of the first artists from the country to open doors for international collaborations. With over [https://open.spotify.com/artist/4IKVDbCSBTxBeAsMKjAuTs 20 million monthly listeners], he has built a career that bridges cultures—seamlessly moving between pop and playback.

A true multilingual powerhouse, he has sung in multiple languages, including Hindi, Telugu, Tamil, Kannada, Malayalam, English and others. His discography spans chartbusters like [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EpEraRui1pc&list=RDEpEraRui1pc&start_radio=1 Bol Do Na Zara], [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y9PvJG8BnqY&list=RDy9PvJG8BnqY&start_radio=1 Butta Bomma], [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n_kZi0i-CsM&list=RDn_kZi0i-CsM&start_radio=1 Control], and [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GsdYjCLcpN4&list=RDGsdYjCLcpN4&start_radio=1 You]. His recent projects include Saanvarey, a wedding EP dedicated to his wife Aashna, and What in the World, created in collaboration with Nature in support of the planet—reflecting an artist who continues to expand his horizons while staying deeply personal in his storytelling
